q: One of the CIA's victims was Mamdouh Habib , an Egyptian-born Australian citizen. U.S. agents bought him from Pakistani intelligence and shipped him to Egypt. "In Egypt," reports Lisa Hajjar for Al Jazeera, he was repeatedly subjected to electric shocks, immersed in water up to his nostrils and beaten. His fingers were broken and he was hung from metal hooks. At one point, his interrogator slapped him so hard that his blindfold was dislodged, revealing the identity of his tormentor: Omar Suleiman . Frustrated that Mamdouh Habib was not providing useful information or confessing to involvement in terrorism, Omar Suleiman ordered a guard to murder a shackled prisoner in front of Mamdouh Habib , which he did with a vicious karate kick. Ibn al-Sheikh al-Libi was a former trainer in the Afghan jihadi camps who famously "confessed" a connection between Saddam and Al Qaeda while under torture in one of Omar Suleiman 's dungeons. According to Eric Schmidt : Larry will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google's Chief Executive Officer. In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly. The third leg of the triumvirate, Sergey Brin , will take the title of Co-Founder, focusing on new products. In an interview with ABC news on the eve of the book's release, Donald Rumsfeld said, What you know today can help you unthink your thinking about tomorrow. Donald Rumsfeld said, "It can't help you with things you were thinking about back then," and added, "Back then there was reasonable confidence that[ Saddam Hussein ] had these weapons."

A healthy Carmelo Anthony scored 25 points, Allen Iverson had 24 points and 13 assists, and the Denver Nuggets beat the Charlotte Bobcats 117-101 on Saturday night. It didn't hurt at all, said Carmelo Anthony , who missed five games after landing on the foot of Kobe Bryant on Jan. 21. "It felt good to be back."
